message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY

This paper proposes a method for hierarchical learning that uses human demonstrations to infer subgoals and decompose the learning problem into high-level and low-level representations. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), computer vision (cs.CV), and systems and control (cs.SY). Given the focus on learning and inference, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely categories, followed by cs.RO due to the application to a simulated robotics problem. The use of computer vision in the Atari game task and the potential for control systems applications also make cs.CV and cs.SY likely categories, respectively.
